summary: This bill, the Connecticut River Watershed Partnership Act, directs the Secretary of the Interior to establish a nonregulatory program and a voluntary grant program to restore and protect the 5-State Connecticut River Watershed region. The programs involve collaboration with various entities, including Federal, Tribal, State, and local governments, to identify, prioritize, and implement restoration activities. The grant program will provide competitive matching grants to eligible entities. The bill outlines the purposes of the program, including improving water quality, supporting fish and wildlife, engaging environmental justice communities, and advancing nature-based solutions. Annual reports to Congress and authorized appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2030 are also included.
